title: Australian Survivor All-Stars confirms first eight cast members
text:
Channel 10 has announced the first eight cast members from Australian Survivor: All-Stars.

The cast includes some of the most memorable faces from season one, including super-fan Nick Iadanza, the strategic Phoebe Timmins, and Felicity 'Flick' Egginton.

Also back are season two's 'Zen' Henry Nicholson and fan favourite Mark 'Tarzan' Herlaar.

REVEALED: Channel 10 has announced the first eight cast members from Australian Survivor: All-Stars

Rounding out the superstar cast is rugby legend Mat Rogers from Champions Vs. Contenders, and recent villain David Genat.

Australian Survivor casts usually consists of around 25 contestants, so expect more memorable Survivor stars to be announced soon.

In other exciting news, Channel 10 has announced that they will air TWO seasons of Australian Survivor in 2020.

He's back! Rugby legend Mat Rogers from Champions Vs. Contenders is back for another shot

First, the All-Stars season will kick off in February, followed by another season towards the end of the year.

The most recent season of Australian Survivor was a huge ratings winner for 10.

Last month, 1.04 million metro viewers tuned in to see Pia Miranda crowned the winner, easily beating out The Block's 857,000 viewers.

Fan boy! Season one super-fan Nick Iadanza is returning to the show, four years after competing on season one

Blondes have more fun! Season one's strategic villains Phoebe Timmins (L) and Flick Egginton (R) are also back

Pia defeated PhD student Baden Gilbert to win the $500,000 cash prize on Champions Vs. Contenders finale.

Reacting to the magnificent news, the 46-year-old thanked her former rivals for voting for her to win, saying: 'I can't believe I won Survivor!'

In the end, it all came down to her subtle gameplay and deep connections, both of which got her enough votes from her peers to win.

Remember me? Bondi hipster 'Zen' Henry Nicholson has returned for another shot at fame

As she accepted her victory, Pia confessed she never thought she'd make it to the end.

'I just paid off my mortgage in seven traumatising weeks. This was the most amazing experience of my life!' she said.

'I have come away from this a better person. Playing Survivor was a lifelong dream.'
description: Channel 10 has announced the first eight cast members from Australian Survivor: All-Stars.
